movie_title: Why were there three popes at the same time? - Joëlle Rollo-Koster
introduction: Dig into the history of the Papal Schism, which caused a split in the Catholic Church while 3 popes

vocabulary.definition: the state or condition of being superior to all others in authority, power, or status
vocabulary.example: The king's supremacy over the land was unquestioned by his subjects.

vocabulary.definition: an excessive amount or number of something
vocabulary.example: The store had a plethora of options for customers to choose from.

vocabulary.definition: a difficult, unpleasant, or embarrassing situation
vocabulary.example: Finding himself in a predicament, he had to come up with a quick solution.

vocabulary.definition: a split or division between strongly opposed sections or parties, caused by differences in opinion or belief
vocabulary.example: The schism within the political party led to internal conflicts and rival factions.

vocabulary.definition: a person who takes a position of power or importance illegally or by force
vocabulary.example: The rebel leader was seen as an usurper by the ruling government.

vocabulary.definition: officially exclude someone from participation in the sacraments and services of the Christian Church
vocabulary.example: The bishop threatened to excommunicate anyone who disobeyed the church's teachings.
